column1: Legend has it the town derives its name from the lukbán or pomelo tree. Three hunters from neighbouring Majayjay— namely Marcos Tigla
column2: Luis Gamba and Lucas Mañawa— lost their way following the trail of wild animals at the foot of volcanic Mount Banahaw. Resting under a tree
column3: they saw a crow (uwák) in the tree's branches
column4: and believing this to be a bad omen
column5: they moved to another place and rested again. Whilst in the shade of a large pomelo (lucbán) tree
column6: the trio were attracted to a couple of kingfishers (salacsác) that were singing. Fascinated by the bird's plumage and rhythmic chirps
column7: the superstitious hunters took this a sign of good fortune and thus settled in the place they named "Lucbán."
